article.title: Parametric Imaging of FDG-PET Data Using Physiology and Iterative Regularization: Application to the Hepatic and Renal Systems

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about the compartmental models in Figure 1 is INCORRECT?
choices: The hepatic model has two compartments: "free" and "metabolized".
The renal model includes a compartment representing the urine.
Both models include an artery compartment representing tracer input.
The renal model shows tracer flow from the "metabolized" compartment back to the "free" compartment.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 displays reconstructed parametric images for a selected PET slice of the hepatic system. What do the different colors in these images represent?
choices: Different anatomical structures within the liver.
The spatial distribution of specific kinetic parameters.
The concentration of the tracer at different time points.
The noise levels present in the original PET data.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 shows the reconstructed parametric images for a selected PET slice of the renal system. What observation can be made about the renal tissue based on these images?
choices: The renal tissue appears homogenous in terms of tracer kinetics.
The different structures within the kidney exhibit distinct kinetic properties.
The renal cortex and medulla cannot be differentiated based on these images.
The tracer uptake is uniform throughout the entire kidney.

multiple_choice_question.text: The article describes a method for parametric imaging using FDG-PET data. Which mathematical technique is NOT used in this method?
